metadata.content: Google Pay is my go-to UPI app for all my digital transactions. It's incredibly user-friendly, allowing me to send and receive money effortlessly. The interface is intuitive, making navigation a breeze. What I appreciate most is its reliability; transactions are swift and secure. Plus, the app offers a range of services like bill payments and recharge options, making it a one-stop solution for all my financial needs. Highly recommended!

metadata.content: It has been over three years since the Flutter-based version was released, yet the app still feels very sluggish and jittery even on a flagship phone, especially during scrolling. However, I really like the fact it stores transaction history indefinitely, and doesn't hide the VPA of online merchants in transaction history, which PhonePe is notorious for. It would have been great if you could add an option to copy transaction details to clipboard.

metadata.content: Google Pay is my go-to UPI app for all my digital transactions. It's incredibly user-friendly, allowing me to send and receive money effortlessly. The interface is intuitive, making navigation a breeze. What I appreciate most is its reliability; transactions are swift and secure. Plus, the app offers a range of services like bill payments and recharge options, making it a one-stop solution for all my financial needs. Highly recommended!

main_text: Google Pay is my go-to UPI app for all my digital transactions. It's incredibly user-friendly, allowing me to send and receive money effortlessly. The interface is intuitive, making navigation a breeze. What I appreciate most is its reliability; transactions are swift and secure. Plus, the app offers a range of services like bill payments and recharge options, making it a one-stop solution for all my financial needs. Highly recommended!

metadata.content: It has been over three years since the Flutter-based version was released, yet the app still feels very sluggish and jittery even on a flagship phone, especially during scrolling. However, I really like the fact it stores transaction history indefinitely, and doesn't hide the VPA of online merchants in transaction history, which PhonePe is notorious for. It would have been great if you could add an option to copy transaction details to clipboard.

main_text: It has been over three years since the Flutter-based version was released, yet the app still feels very sluggish and jittery even on a flagship phone, especially during scrolling. However, I really like the fact it stores transaction history indefinitely, and doesn't hide the VPA of online merchants in transaction history, which PhonePe is notorious for. It would have been great if you could add an option to copy transaction details to clipboard.

metadata.content: After upgrading phone to Android 14, Google Pay stopped working. No errors. Just does nothing when you click final Pay button before pin is asked. Update: Google Pay makes use of org.npci.upi.security.pinactivitycomponent.GetCredential which is the point of failure. All UPI apps that use were also broken. Fixed it by clearing app data and setting the app again.
metadata.replyContent: Regret the inconvenience. Please ensure that you're using the latest version of the app with a stable internet connection. For more info, check out our Help Center: https://goo.gle/3aQkQu3. For further assistance you can reach out to our support team: https://goo.gle/2PQQFuc.

metadata.content: This is NOT like a debt card. Do you need a phone number to set up your physical debt card? No. Can you use your phone to get money from any ATM? Then this IS the app for you. 2024 and the technology STILL does not exist for seemless NFC EVERYTIME at point of sale (you know, like real money in hand?).
